1: %% @doc Common Test Suite for RouterAdmin gRPC Integration Tests
    2: -module(router_admin_grpc_integration_SUITE).
    3: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    4: -include_lib("eunit/include/eunit.hrl").
    5: 
    6: -include("../include/beamline_router.hrl").
    7: -include("../include/flow_pb.hrl").
    8: -include_lib("grpcbox/include/grpcbox.hrl").
    9: -include("router_grpc_test_helper.hrl").
   10: 
   11: -compile(export_all).
   12: 
   13: %% Test suite callbacks
   14: all() ->
   15:     [
   16:         test_upsert_policy_success,
   17:         test_upsert_policy_invalid_weights,
   18:         test_upsert_policy_unauthorized,
   19:         test_upsert_policy_invalid_key,
   20:         test_upsert_policy_invalid_format,
   21:         test_delete_policy_success,
   22:         test_delete_policy_not_found,
   23:         test_get_policy_success,
   24:         test_get_policy_not_found,
   25:         test_list_policies_success,
   26:         test_upsert_and_decide_integration,
   27:         test_delete_and_decide_integration,
   28:         test_admin_telemetry_correlation_id
   29:         %% Future: test_permission_denied - when role/scope model is implemented
   30:     ].
   31: 
   32: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   33:     %% Start application with ephemeral port
   34:     _ = application:load(beamline_router),  %% Ignore if already loaded
   35:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_port, 0),  %% Ephemeral port
   36:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, admin_api_key, <<"test-admin-key">>),
   37:     {ok, _} = application:ensure_all_started(beamline_router),
   38:     
   39:     %% Wait for gRPC server to start
   40:     timer:sleep(1000),
   41:     
   42:     %% Get actual port (fallback to default if not available)
   43:     ActualPort = case application:get_env(beamline_router, grpc_port) of
   44:         {ok, P} when is_integer(P), P > 0 -> P;
   45:         _ -> 9000  %% Fallback
   46:     end,
   47:     
   48:     [{grpc_port, ActualPort}, {admin_api_key, <<"test-admin-key">>} | Config].
   49: 
   50: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   51:     application:stop(beamline_router),
   52:     Config.
   53: 
   54: %% Test: UpsertPolicy success
   55: test_upsert_policy_success(Config) ->
   56:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
   57:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
   58:     
   59:     %% Create AdminPolicy
   60:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
   61:         policy_id = <<"test_policy">>,
   62:         providers = [
   63:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7},
   64:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"anthropic">>, weight = 0.3}
   65:         ],
   66:         sticky = false,
   67:         rules = []
   68:     },
   69:     
   70:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
   71:         tenant_id = TenantId,
   72:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
   73:     },
   74:     
   75:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
   76:     
   77:     %% Call gRPC method directly (simulating client call)
   78:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
   79:     Result = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, Request),
   80:     
   81:     ?assertMatch({ok, _Response, _Ctx}, Result),
   82:     {ok, Response, _} = Result,
   83:     
   84:     %% Decode response
   85:     ResponsePb = flow_pb:decode_msg(Response, 'UpsertPolicyResponse'),
   86:     ?assertEqual(true, ResponsePb#'UpsertPolicyResponse'.ok),
   87:     
   88:     ok.
   89: 
   90: %% Test: UpsertPolicy invalid weights
   91: test_upsert_policy_invalid_weights(Config) ->
   92:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
   93:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
   94:     
   95:     %% Create AdminPolicy with invalid weight (> 1.0)
   96:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
   97:         policy_id = <<"invalid_policy">>,
   98:         providers = [
   99:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 1.5}  %% Invalid
  100:         ],
  101:         sticky = false,
  102:         rules = []
  103:     },
  104:     
  105:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  106:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  107:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  108:     },
  109:     
  110:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  111:     
  112:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  113:     
  114:     %% Should throw grpc_error with INVALID_ARGUMENT
  115:     try
  116:         router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, Request),
  117:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  118:     catch
  119:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  120:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_INVALID_ARGUMENT, Status)
  121:     end,
  122:     
  123:     ok.
  124: 
  125: %% Test: UpsertPolicy unauthorized (no key)
  126: test_upsert_policy_unauthorized(Config) ->
  127:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  128:     
  129:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  130:         policy_id = <<"test_policy">>,
  131:         providers = [
  132:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}
  133:         ],
  134:         sticky = false,
  135:         rules = []
  136:     },
  137:     
  138:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  139:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  140:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  141:     },
  142:     
  143:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  144:     
  145:     %% Create context without auth
  146:     Ctx = create_context_without_auth(),
  147:     
  148:     %% Should throw grpc_error with UNAUTHENTICATED
  149:     try
  150:         router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, Request),
  151:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  152:     catch
  153:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  154:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_UNAUTHENTICATED, Status)
  155:     end,
  156:     
  157:     ok.
  158: 
  159: %% Test: UpsertPolicy unauthorized (invalid key)
  160: test_upsert_policy_invalid_key(Config) ->
  161:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  162:     
  163:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  164:         policy_id = <<"test_policy">>,
  165:         providers = [
  166:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}
  167:         ],
  168:         sticky = false,
  169:         rules = []
  170:     },
  171:     
  172:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  173:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  174:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  175:     },
  176:     
  177:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  178:     
  179:     %% Create context with invalid key
  180:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(<<"wrong-key">>),
  181:     
  182:     %% Should throw grpc_error with UNAUTHENTICATED
  183:     try
  184:         router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, Request),
  185:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  186:     catch
  187:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  188:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_UNAUTHENTICATED, Status)
  189:     end,
  190:     
  191:     ok.
  192: 
  193: %% Test: UpsertPolicy unauthorized (invalid format - empty key)
  194: %% Empty key should still return UNAUTHENTICATED, not INVALID_ARGUMENT
  195: test_upsert_policy_invalid_format(Config) ->
  196:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  197:     
  198:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  199:         policy_id = <<"test_policy">>,
  200:         providers = [
  201:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}
  202:         ],
  203:         sticky = false,
  204:         rules = []
  205:     },
  206:     
  207:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  208:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  209:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  210:     },
  211:     
  212:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  213:     
  214:     %% Test various malformed auth formats - all should return UNAUTHENTICATED
  215:     
  216:     %% Test 1: Empty x-api-key
  217:     Ctx1 = #{metadata => [{<<"x-api-key">>, <<>>}]},
  218:     test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx1, Request, "empty x-api-key"),
  219:     
  220:     %% Test 2: Empty Bearer token
  221:     Ctx2 = #{metadata => [{<<"authorization">>, <<"Bearer ">>}]},
  222:     test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx2, Request, "empty Bearer token"),
  223:     
  224:     %% Test 3: Bearer with only whitespace
  225:     Ctx3 = #{metadata => [{<<"authorization">>, <<"Bearer  ">>}]},
  226:     test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx3, Request, "Bearer with whitespace"),
  227:     
  228:     %% Test 4: Bearer with tab
  229:     Ctx4 = #{metadata => [{<<"authorization">>, <<"Bearer\t">>}]},
  230:     test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx4, Request, "Bearer with tab"),
  231:     
  232:     %% Test 5: Just "Bearer" without space
  233:     Ctx5 = #{metadata => [{<<"authorization">>, <<"Bearer">>}]},
  234:     test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx5, Request, "Bearer without space"),
  235:     
  236:     ok.
  237: 
  238: %% Helper: Test that auth error returns UNAUTHENTICATED, not INVALID_ARGUMENT
  239: test_auth_returns_unauthorized(Ctx, Request, Description) ->
  240:     try
  241:         router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, Request),
  242:         ct:fail("Should have thrown grpc_error for ~s", [Description])
  243:     catch
  244:         {grpc_error, {Status, Message}} ->
  245:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_UNAUTHENTICATED, Status, 
  246:                         io_lib:format("~s should return UNAUTHENTICATED, not INVALID_ARGUMENT", [Description])),
  247:             %% Verify it's not INVALID_ARGUMENT
  248:             ?assertNotEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_INVALID_ARGUMENT, Status,
  249:                            io_lib:format("Should not be INVALID_ARGUMENT for auth issues: ~s", [Description])),
  250:             ct:log("~s: Received UNAUTHENTICATED (correct) with message: ~p", [Description, Message])
  251:     end.
  252: 
  253: %% Test: DeletePolicy success
  254: test_delete_policy_success(Config) ->
  255:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  256:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  257:     PolicyId = <<"delete_test">>,
  258:     
  259:     %% Create policy first
  260:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  261:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  262:         providers = [
  263:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}
  264:         ],
  265:         sticky = false,
  266:         rules = []
  267:     },
  268:     
  269:     UpsertRequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  270:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  271:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  272:     },
  273:     
  274:     UpsertRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  275:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  276:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest),
  277:     
  278:     %% Delete policy
  279:     DeleteRequestPb = #'DeletePolicyRequest'{
  280:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  281:         policy_id = PolicyId
  282:     },
  283:     
  284:     DeleteRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(DeleteRequestPb, 'DeletePolicyRequest'),
  285:     Result = router_admin_grpc:delete_policy(Ctx, DeleteRequest),
  286:     
  287:     ?assertMatch({ok, _Response, _Ctx}, Result),
  288:     {ok, Response, _} = Result,
  289:     
  290:     ResponsePb = flow_pb:decode_msg(Response, 'DeletePolicyResponse'),
  291:     ?assertEqual(true, ResponsePb#'DeletePolicyResponse'.ok),
  292:     
  293:     ok.
  294: 
  295: %% Test: DeletePolicy not found
  296: test_delete_policy_not_found(Config) ->
  297:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  298:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  299:     PolicyId = <<"nonexistent">>,
  300:     
  301:     DeleteRequestPb = #'DeletePolicyRequest'{
  302:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  303:         policy_id = PolicyId
  304:     },
  305:     
  306:     DeleteRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(DeleteRequestPb, 'DeletePolicyRequest'),
  307:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  308:     
  309:     %% Should throw grpc_error with NOT_FOUND
  310:     try
  311:         router_admin_grpc:delete_policy(Ctx, DeleteRequest),
  312:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  313:     catch
  314:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  315:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_NOT_FOUND, Status)
  316:     end,
  317:     
  318:     ok.
  319: 
  320: %% Test: GetPolicy success
  321: test_get_policy_success(Config) ->
  322:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  323:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  324:     PolicyId = <<"get_test">>,
  325:     
  326:     %% Create policy first
  327:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  328:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  329:         providers = [
  330:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7},
  331:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"anthropic">>, weight = 0.3}
  332:         ],
  333:         sticky = true,
  334:         rules = []
  335:     },
  336:     
  337:     UpsertRequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  338:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  339:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  340:     },
  341:     
  342:     UpsertRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  343:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  344:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest),
  345:     
  346:     %% Get policy
  347:     GetRequestPb = #'GetPolicyRequest'{
  348:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  349:         policy_id = PolicyId
  350:     },
  351:     
  352:     GetRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(GetRequestPb, 'GetPolicyRequest'),
  353:     Result = router_admin_grpc:get_policy(Ctx, GetRequest),
  354:     
  355:     ?assertMatch({ok, _Response, _Ctx}, Result),
  356:     {ok, Response, _} = Result,
  357:     
  358:     ResponsePb = flow_pb:decode_msg(Response, 'GetPolicyResponse'),
  359:     RetrievedPolicy = ResponsePb#'GetPolicyResponse'.policy,
  360:     ?assertEqual(PolicyId, RetrievedPolicy#'AdminPolicy'.policy_id),
  361:     ?assertEqual(2, length(RetrievedPolicy#'AdminPolicy'.providers)),
  362:     
  363:     ok.
  364: 
  365: %% Test: GetPolicy not found
  366: test_get_policy_not_found(Config) ->
  367:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  368:     TenantId = <<"test_tenant">>,
  369:     PolicyId = <<"nonexistent">>,
  370:     
  371:     GetRequestPb = #'GetPolicyRequest'{
  372:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  373:         policy_id = PolicyId
  374:     },
  375:     
  376:     GetRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(GetRequestPb, 'GetPolicyRequest'),
  377:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  378:     
  379:     %% Should throw grpc_error with NOT_FOUND
  380:     try
  381:         router_admin_grpc:get_policy(Ctx, GetRequest),
  382:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  383:     catch
  384:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  385:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_NOT_FOUND, Status)
  386:     end,
  387:     
  388:     ok.
  389: 
  390: %% Test: ListPolicies success
  391: test_list_policies_success(Config) ->
  392:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  393:     TenantId = <<"list_test_tenant">>,
  394:     
  395:     %% Create multiple policies
  396:     Policy1 = #'AdminPolicy'{
  397:         policy_id = <<"list_policy1">>,
  398:         providers = [#'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}],
  399:         sticky = false,
  400:         rules = []
  401:     },
  402:     
  403:     Policy2 = #'AdminPolicy'{
  404:         policy_id = <<"list_policy2">>,
  405:         providers = [#'AdminProvider'{id = <<"anthropic">>, weight = 0.5}],
  406:         sticky = false,
  407:         rules = []
  408:     },
  409:     
  410:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  411:     
  412:     UpsertRequest1Pb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  413:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  414:         policy = Policy1
  415:     },
  416:     UpsertRequest2Pb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  417:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  418:         policy = Policy2
  419:     },
  420:     
  421:     UpsertRequest1 = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequest1Pb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  422:     UpsertRequest2 = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequest2Pb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  423:     
  424:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest1),
  425:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest2),
  426:     
  427:     %% List policies
  428:     ListRequestPb = #'ListPoliciesRequest'{
  429:         tenant_id = TenantId
  430:     },
  431:     
  432:     ListRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(ListRequestPb, 'ListPoliciesRequest'),
  433:     Result = router_admin_grpc:list_policies(Ctx, ListRequest),
  434:     
  435:     ?assertMatch({ok, _Response, _Ctx}, Result),
  436:     {ok, Response, _} = Result,
  437:     
  438:     ResponsePb = flow_pb:decode_msg(Response, 'ListPoliciesResponse'),
  439:     Policies = ResponsePb#'ListPoliciesResponse'.policies,
  440:     ?assert(length(Policies) >= 2),
  441:     
  442:     PolicyIds = [P#'AdminPolicy'.policy_id || P <- Policies],
  443:     ?assert(lists:member(<<"list_policy1">>, PolicyIds)),
  444:     ?assert(lists:member(<<"list_policy2">>, PolicyIds)),
  445:     
  446:     ok.
  447: 
  448: %% Test: UpsertPolicy and Router.Decide integration
  449: test_upsert_and_decide_integration(Config) ->
  450:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  451:     TenantId = <<"integration_tenant">>,
  452:     PolicyId = <<"integration_policy">>,
  453:     
  454:     %% Create policy via Admin API
  455:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  456:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  457:         providers = [
  458:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"anthropic">>, weight = 1.0}  %% 100% anthropic
  459:         ],
  460:         sticky = false,
  461:         rules = []
  462:     },
  463:     
  464:     UpsertRequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  465:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  466:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  467:     },
  468:     
  469:     UpsertRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  470:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  471:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest),
  472:     
  473:     %% Use Router.Decide with new policy
  474:     MessagePb = #'Message'{
  475:         message_id = <<"test_msg">>,
  476:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  477:         message_type = <<"chat">>,
  478:         payload = <<"Test">>,
  479:         metadata = [],
  480:         timestamp_ms = erlang:system_time(millisecond)
  481:     },
  482:     
  483:     RouteRequestPb = #'RouteRequest'{
  484:         message = MessagePb,
  485:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  486:         context = []
  487:     },
  488:     
  489:     RouteRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(RouteRequestPb, 'RouteRequest'),
  490:     DecideResult = router_grpc:decide(Ctx, RouteRequest),
  491:     
  492:     ?assertMatch({ok, _Response, _Ctx}, DecideResult),
  493:     {ok, DecisionResponse, _} = DecideResult,
  494:     
  495:     DecisionPb = flow_pb:decode_msg(DecisionResponse, 'RouteDecision'),
  496:     %% Should route to anthropic (100% weight)
  497:     ?assertEqual(<<"anthropic">>, DecisionPb#'RouteDecision'.provider_id),
  498:     
  499:     ok.
  500: 
  501: %% Test: DeletePolicy and Router.Decide integration
  502: test_delete_and_decide_integration(Config) ->
  503:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  504:     TenantId = <<"delete_integration_tenant">>,
  505:     PolicyId = <<"delete_integration_policy">>,
  506:     
  507:     %% Create policy
  508:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  509:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  510:         providers = [
  511:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 1.0}
  512:         ],
  513:         sticky = false,
  514:         rules = []
  515:     },
  516:     
  517:     UpsertRequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  518:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  519:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  520:     },
  521:     
  522:     UpsertRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(UpsertRequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  523:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  524:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(Ctx, UpsertRequest),
  525:     
  526:     %% Delete policy
  527:     DeleteRequestPb = #'DeletePolicyRequest'{
  528:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  529:         policy_id = PolicyId
  530:     },
  531:     
  532:     DeleteRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(DeleteRequestPb, 'DeletePolicyRequest'),
  533:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:delete_policy(Ctx, DeleteRequest),
  534:     
  535:     %% Try to use Router.Decide with deleted policy
  536:     MessagePb = #'Message'{
  537:         message_id = <<"test_msg">>,
  538:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  539:         message_type = <<"chat">>,
  540:         payload = <<"Test">>,
  541:         metadata = [],
  542:         timestamp_ms = erlang:system_time(millisecond)
  543:     },
  544:     
  545:     RouteRequestPb = #'RouteRequest'{
  546:         message = MessagePb,
  547:         policy_id = PolicyId,
  548:         context = []
  549:     },
  550:     
  551:     RouteRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(RouteRequestPb, 'RouteRequest'),
  552:     
  553:     %% Should return policy_not_found error
  554:     try
  555:         router_grpc:decide(Ctx, RouteRequest),
  556:         ?assert(false, "Should have thrown grpc_error")
  557:     catch
  558:         {grpc_error, {Status, _Message}} ->
  559:             ?assertEqual(?GRPC_STATUS_NOT_FOUND, Status)
  560:     end,
  561:     
  562:     ok.
  563: 
  564: %% Test: Admin telemetry with correlation_id
  565: test_admin_telemetry_correlation_id(Config) ->
  566:     AdminKey = proplists:get_value(admin_api_key, Config),
  567:     TenantId = <<"telemetry_admin_tenant">>,
  568:     CorrelationId = <<"test-admin-correlation-id-67890">>,
  569:     
  570:     %% Create context with correlation_id
  571:     Ctx = create_context_with_auth(AdminKey),
  572:     CtxWithCorr = Ctx#{metadata => [{<<"x-correlation-id">>, CorrelationId} | maps:get(metadata, Ctx, [])]},
  573:     
  574:     %% Create test policy
  575:     AdminPolicyPb = #'AdminPolicy'{
  576:         policy_id = <<"telemetry_admin_policy">>,
  577:         providers = [
  578:             #'AdminProvider'{id = <<"openai">>, weight = 0.7}
  579:         ],
  580:         sticky = false,
  581:         rules = []
  582:     },
  583:     
  584:     RequestPb = #'UpsertPolicyRequest'{
  585:         tenant_id = TenantId,
  586:         policy = AdminPolicyPb
  587:     },
  588:     Request = flow_pb:encode_msg(RequestPb, 'UpsertPolicyRequest'),
  589:     
  590:     %% Capture telemetry events
  591:     HandlerId = make_ref(),
  592:     Self = self(),
  593:     Handler = fun(Event, Measurements, Metadata, _Config) ->
  594:         Self ! {telemetry, Event, Measurements, Metadata}
  595:     end,
  596:     
  597:     %% Attach telemetry handler for router_admin events
  598:     telemetry:attach(HandlerId, [router_admin, list], Handler, #{}),
  599:     
  600:     %% Call list_policies with correlation_id
  601:     ListRequestPb = #'ListPoliciesRequest'{tenant_id = TenantId},
  602:     ListRequest = flow_pb:encode_msg(ListRequestPb, 'ListPoliciesRequest'),
  603:     
  604:     %% First upsert policy
  605:     {ok, _, _} = router_admin_grpc:upsert_policy(CtxWithCorr, Request),
  606:     
  607:     %% Then list policies
  608:     {ok, ListResponse, _} = router_admin_grpc:list_policies(CtxWithCorr, ListRequest),
  609:     ListResponsePb = flow_pb:decode_msg(ListResponse, 'ListPoliciesResponse'),
  610:     ?assert(length(ListResponsePb#'ListPoliciesResponse'.policies) >= 1),
  611:     
  612:     %% Wait for telemetry event
  613:     receive
  614:         {telemetry, [router_admin, list], Measurements, Metadata} ->
  615:             %% Verify measurements
  616:             ?assert(maps:is_key(count, Measurements), "count should be present"),
  617:             ?assert(is_integer(maps:get(count, Measurements)), "count should be integer"),
  618:             
  619:             %% Verify metadata
  620:             ?assert(maps:is_key(tenant_id, Metadata), "tenant_id should be present"),
  621:             ?assert(maps:is_key(result, Metadata), "result should be present"),
  622:             ?assertEqual(TenantId, maps:get(tenant_id, Metadata), "tenant_id should match"),
  623:             ?assertEqual(ok, maps:get(result, Metadata), "result should be ok (not success)"),
  624:             ?assert(maps:is_key(correlation_id, Metadata), "correlation_id should be present"),
  625:             ?assertEqual(CorrelationId, maps:get(correlation_id, Metadata), "correlation_id should match"),
  626:             ok
  627:     after 1000 ->
  628:         ?assert(false, "Telemetry event not received within timeout")
  629:     end,
  630:     
  631:     %% Cleanup
  632:     telemetry:detach(HandlerId),
  633:     
  634:     ok.
  635: 
  636: %% Helper: Create context with authorization
  637: create_context_with_auth(AdminKey) ->
  638:     %% Create mock context with metadata
  639:     Metadata = [
  640:         {<<"x-api-key">>, AdminKey}
  641:     ],
  642:     %% grpcbox context structure (simplified for testing)
  643:     #{metadata => Metadata}.
  644: 
  645: %% Helper: Create context without authorization
  646: create_context_without_auth() ->
  647:     #{metadata => []}.
  648:
